karna_story.role: Great warrior, son of Surya (Sun God), loyal friend of Duryodhana

birth.circumstances: Born with divine armor (Kavacha) and earrings (Kundala), abandoned and raised by a charioteer.

keyevents: Gifted away his divine armor to Indra
Crowned King of Anga by Duryodhana

philosophicalsignificance: Symbol of loyalty even at personal cost

majordilemmas.name: Identity Crisis
majordilemmas.description: Born as a Kshatriya but raised as a charioteer’s son, Karna faced rejection and humiliation despite his warrior skills.

majordilemmas.name: Loyalty to Duryodhana
majordilemmas.description: Bound by gratitude to Duryodhana, Karna chose friendship over righteousness, even when he knew Duryodhana’s actions were unjust.

majordilemmas.name: Refusal to Join Pandavas
majordilemmas.description: When Kunti revealed his true identity before the war, Karna refused to abandon Duryodhana, prioritizing loyalty over blood ties.

majordilemmas.name: Gift of Armor and Earrings
majordilemmas.description: Karna gave away his divine protection to Indra, knowing it would cost him his life, upholding his vow of generosity.

majordilemmas.name: Curses Impacting Fate
majordilemmas.description: Cursed by a Brahmin and his guru Parashurama, Karna faced inevitable defeat despite his valor and skill.

cursesandconsequences.reason: Accidentally killed a cow mistaking it for a wild animal.
cursesandconsequences.consequence: Cursed that his chariot wheel would sink in battle, leading to his vulnerability during the war.

cursesandconsequences.reason: Lied about his lineage to learn archery from Parashurama.
cursesandconsequences.consequence: Cursed that he would forget the Brahmastra mantra at a crucial moment in battle.

cursesandconsequences.reason: Insulted a woman by pulling her by the hair.
cursesandconsequences.consequence: Cursed that the earth would trap his chariot wheel during the war.

mantrasandinvocations.name: Surya Mantra (for Karna’s lineage)
mantrasandinvocations.meaning: Salutation to Surya, the Sun God.

timeline.event: Born to Kunti and Surya with divine armor and earrings; abandoned and set afloat in a river.
Raised by Adhiratha and Radha, a charioteer family; trained in archery secretly.
Rejected by Dronacharya due to low birth; cursed by Parashurama after lying about lineage.
Humiliated during archery contest; befriended by Duryodhana who crowns him King of Anga.
Gives away his divine armor and earrings to Indra, knowing it will cost him his life.
Refuses Kunti’s offer to join Pandavas; pledges loyalty to Duryodhana.
Fights valiantly; forgets Brahmastra mantra due to curse; chariot wheel sinks; killed by Arjuna.
Remembered as the greatest giver (Daanveer) and tragic hero of Mahabharata.
